body:
You will also have to add a line for the image...

`public static final String PRODUCT_IMAGE = "image";` or whatever you will use of course.

Good work creating an empty constructor and setting it `private`.
 
There are three common reasons to define a default constructor:
 
1. To construct an object with default values.
2. To initialize an object that doesn't need parameters in that initialization process.
3. To redefine the scope of the constructor. Making the constructor private will prevent anyone but the class itself from constructing an object.
 
The last reason here explains why to set the empty constructor as private.
 
There is much to read up on for the topic whether we need one or not. For example, see [**this post**](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/402514/why-might-one-also-use-a-blank-constructor) in StackOverflow, often a good source to have questions answered about programming details.
